fields.description:
Please wrap the non-markdown README viewer (on a project's homepage) in <pre> tags so that fixed-format (e.g. 80 characters per line) text  (sometimes containing ASCII art diagrams) is rendered properly. Many README files depend on not being line-wrapped and viewed in a monospace font.

One possibility would be to check whether there are any lines longer than 80 characters and enabling the fixed-format viewer only on files where there are not.
fields.summary: Wrap README in <pre> (BB-11902)

fields.description:
Hello BitBucket,

I'm trying to import Pytbull (https://sourceforge.net/projects/pytbull/) from SourceForge but I keep getting error messages.

If I put "pytbull" as "Project name" and nothing as "Mount point" I get the error message "No repository exists at that URL.", with the URL being http://pytbull.hg.sourceforge.net:8000/hgroot/pytbull

If I put "pytbull" as "Project name" and "code" as "Mount point" I still get the error message "No repository exists at that URL.", with the URL being http://hg.code.sf.net/p/pytbull/code

If I put "pytbull/code" as "Project name" and nothing as "Mount point" I get "Unsupported protocol. Please use 'http://', 'https://' , 'svn://' or 'git://.'" with an URL http://pytbull/code.hg.sourceforge.net:8000/hgroot/pytbull/code

The hg clone URL should be http://hg.code.sf.net/p/pytbull/code, as can be seen [here|https://sourceforge.net/p/pytbull/code/ci/default/tree/] (don't know what the mount point actually is).

Hoping in a prompt response, thanks in advance,

Antonio
fields.summary: Cannot import hg repository from SourceForge

fields.description:
The Atlassian server requires using weak SSH ciphers. It should allow connecting using better ciphers. The server will not work if client requests stronger key exchange.  It seems to only work with key exchange using weak 25 SHA1 which is known to be broken.

See: https://stribika.github.io/2015/01/04/secure-secure-shell.html

Is this some stupid export restriction thing?
fields.summary: Atlassian does not support secure SSH key modes

fields.description:
It would be quite helpful for editing content files (.txt, .tex, .html, etc.) if the online commit editor had an option to wrap long lines, instead of having to use the horizontal scroll bar.

This is a separate issue from BCLOUD-3873 about the diff viewer; even if the diff viewer doesn't wrap lines, it would be still nice to be able to use the online editor on these files.
fields.summary: Add a line wrapping option for editing files with long lines (BB-11890)

fields.description:
I understand that it is not possible for Bitbucket to support ECDSA for SSH at this time. However I think improvements can still be made. Namely, I wonder if some higher-security MACs could be enabled?

This is the motivating article, for reference: https://stribika.github.io/2015/01/04/secure-secure-shell.html

Some examples of higher-security MACs are hmac-sha2-512-etm@openssh.com and hmac-sha2-256-etm@openssh.com.

Currently the Bitbucket SSH servers advertise these weak MACs to my client:  hmac-md5,hmac-sha1,umac-64@openssh.com,hmac-ripemd160,hmac-ripemd160@openssh.com,hmac-sha1-96,hmac-md5-96.
fields.summary: Support for more secure SSH MACs (BB-11891)

fields.description: JetBrains Kotlin language is missing in the languages list for a repository.

fields.description: Satti
fields.summary: Mr

fields.description:
I would like to add an entire group as reviewer of a pull request.

Maybe the easy way could we an "alias" that automatically add every member in the group as a PR reviewer.

|-----|

We have hundreds of repositories and adding default reviewers to every single one, or every single time when creating a new repository is a pain... Here's what I suggest.
 # Allow creating user groups dedicated as code reviewers.
 # Allow a global, project, target branch and repository setting to use a default user group of code reviewers.
 ## We use projects as brands to separate clients, thus separating development teams and following our legal process of client security by not mixing data.
 # Update the current default reviewers setting to choose 1 or multiple user groups of code reviewers.
 # The branch permissions dialog should inherit the user groups if default reviewers is selected or allow global user group.
 ## Code reviewer user groups may need to have default permission to 'merge via pull request' or at least figure out an updated UX solution for automation.

This would save so much time. Please vote!
fields.summary: Ability to add a group as a reviewer on a PR

fields.description:
Bitbucket uses Git's default behavior when showing commits for a file. This can be misleading at times as Git hides commits it considers irrelevant to it's history. What this means is that _all_ of the changes in the commit that appears missing have been _overridden_ by other subsequent changes in the history. Even though those changes aren't relevant anymore, some users would like to see these commits shown in the history anyway. To do this locally at the command line with Git, simple add {{--full-history}} to any {{git log}} command.

Bitbucket should consider providing a way to do this in the UI, or inform the user if some commits have been hidden by Git due to [History Simplification|http://git-scm.com/docs/git-log]
fields.summary: Add an option switch between git full history and git simplified history

fields.description:
The RSS2 feed for a private project has a pubDate that's in some weird date format.

Actual (example):\\
<pubDate>木, 1 1月 2015 00:29:55 +0000</pubDate>

Expected:\\
<pubDate>01 Jan 2015 00:29:55 +0000</pubDate>

(It's not even a real Japanese date format: "木, 1 1月 2015" has a counter suffix for the month, but not the year or day.  It's in DMY order, which is unusual for Japan, and the weekday is at the start instead of the end.  This is a strange hybrid of American and Japanese date formats that no person or computer could like.)

I guess it's trying to follow some locale setting, but I'm not sure where it's getting this from.  I tried setting my Bitbucket user preference back to English, but I still get Japanese dates.  It's not my HTTP headers, because even curl (which sends no Accept-Language, and Accept:_/_) is getting these dates.

In any event, it shouldn't be using Japanese dates at all:

* RSS2 says that pubDate should be RFC 822, possibly with a 4-digit year: http://validator.w3.org/feed/docs/rss2.html
* RFC 822 seems pretty clear that it doesn't allow localized date formats: https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc0822.txt

This is confusing my RSS reader (and rightly so).  Right now my RSS reader is saying that all Bitbucket events happened in year 0001, at strange days and times.

The URL I'm using looks like: https://bitbucket.org/jonchin/livestories/rss?token=blahblahblah (token removed).
fields.summary: Bitbucket RSS date format is invalid (BB-11845)

Check facebook's front page for example: the login fields are on front page and if you open it, the focus is on it.

fields.description:
Hi All,

I know a lot of people have had this problem, but this is slightly different because I can confirm my configuration is sound as I've been using it these last few days.  However, when I now do:

hg pull --verbose ssh://hg@bitbucket.org/<user>/<repo>

Instead of getting changesets, I get:

remote: conq: repository access denied.\\
abort: no suitable response from remote hg!

I can confirm:

(1) The SSH Key being used is correct (using Pageant on Windows 7 (x64) [Version 6.1.7601] )\\
(2) The SSH Key is the same as that stored in Bitbucket.org account (under 'manage profile -> SSH Keys)\\
(3) I can confirm the username and email settings are correct and exactly match (even in case) the settings under [ui] of <user>/mecurial.ini

So I know this is something quirky to do specifically with Bitbucket, does anyone know how I can work around the bug for now?

Many thanks for your help,

Kind Regards,

Roger Davies

fields.description:
Under certain conditions, commit issue comments may appear a second time when merging a pull request. The person who merged the pull request will appear as the author of this comment.

An issue shouldn't be transitioned again, nor should there be a message, if the issue is already in the transition status.

The person shown to have performed the action is technically accurate as we log all comments to the person who either pushed the commit containing the message, or the person who performed the action on the Bitbucket site.
fields.summary: Issue commit comments are processed again when merging (BB-11792)

fields.description:
We have a few git repositories in our company. Our development model involves developing on our private branches and then merging those with master. The problem with bitbucket is that we get notification emails on commits to ALL branches not specific ones. This is affecting our workflows a lot and is a pain for people who want to keep an eye on repositories for spurios commits. We have tried numerous email filters to weed out private branches but they work as expected. We would ideally like to receive email notifications ONLY ON these type of branches

* master (i.e. a branch name matching a specificed name)
* release-branch-* (i.e. a branch name matching a specified regex)

This is very critical for our workflow.
fields.summary: Send emails only on commits to specific branches (BB-11787)

fields.description:
From a JIRA issue, I can click the link "Create Branch". I am taken to something like this: https://bitbucket.org/branch/create?issueKey=someKey&issueType=Improvement&issueSummary=someTitle

If someTitle is too long, it gets chopped off. I suppose that is fine if git can't handle such a long title, but perhaps trimming silently is a bad idea.

Personally, I think we should be allowed the option to just have it ignore issueSummary altogether. Whenever I use this tool, I have to remember to check the branch name it says it will create so I can make sure it makes sense.

Also, the branch name field is short. Could we have that widened?
fields.summary: Long titles get chopped off silently when creating new branch (BB-11778)

fields.description:
I tried to log in with my username L46kok, but the first message I get is Your account has been deactivated. Googling showed me that this numerous users have experienced this issue as well.

Then I come across this [link|https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issue/10753/your-account-has-been-deactivated-please] and supposedly, I need to raise a ticket somewhere. Ok, so I follow the link to the support center, and this is the screen I see:

!http://s9.postimg.org/wib5inblb/image.png!

? Ok, I don't see any menu that allows me to raise a ticket. Perhaps clicking on "answers" takes me there? So I go in there, and I come across the "Ask a question" button. I click on it and WHAT THE F*@#? I need an account to ask a question?? Is this a joke? You don't expect me to make a second account to raise a ticket, asking for my original account to be reactivated?

Lest you think I'm being too hotheaded about this, your support website design is very unintuitive on how I'm supposed to solve this issue. I mean look, you guys provide a great service and I'm sure you have your reasons for randomly deactivating perfectly valid accounts, but at least you should make the process clear on how to reactivate user's login account.

So I'd like to request my account to be reactivated, but please consider making this process easy for other users in the future. Many thanks.
fields.summary: Your account has been deactivated. Please contact Bitbucket Support for assistance.

fields.description:
Hi,

I would like to see a feature to filter on the approval status of commits. With that possibility it's easier to show unapproved commits.

I'm working in a team and I review code of my colleagues and they'll review my code. So the filter has to check if any user have approved a commit.
fields.summary: Possibility to filter on approval status (BB-11767)

fields.description:
It would be very helpful if some extra filters could be added to the filters list at the top of the Issue Tracker page. At present the list includes:

* All
* Open
* My Issues
* Watching

Please could we also add to this list:

* On Hold
* Unresolved (Open or On Hold etc)
* Resolved

I'm sure this is only a very quick change since its basically just a few anchor tags in HTML to add a few more buttons there, but I think this would be very beneficial to and appreciated by all users of the issue tracker. Thank you.
fields.summary: Additional filters for Issues Tracker (BB-11770)

fields.description:
When logged into BitBucket, and with a repository selected, it would be amazingly helpful if the Issues feature would remember the last selected filter - All/Open/Watching etc, which column the issues are ordered by - Title/Priority/Updated etc, and also which page of results you were last looking at if there are multiple pages of results available. Every time I update an issue and return to the list, I'm constantly returned to the default filter of All, ordered by the Updated column and on page 1 of the results. In reality I *always* want to be on the Open filter and ordered by the Priority column, and so find myself constantly changing these 2 things all day long!

Perhaps a default filter and default ordering column could be chosen as a preference in settings, or remembered in the database and refered to after identifying the logged-in user and session from the session cookie?

Thank you.
fields.summary: Remember preferred Issues tracker view (column used for ordering, selected filters, current page)

fields.description:
cf. https://bitbucket.org/wilhelmy/eggdrop-urlmagic/src/30e52d3a0460aed4c77f937bb1949885bc78f8cb/urlmagic.tcl?at=default#cl-231

In Tcl, everything is a string, therefore " has the same meaning everywhere: A literal quotation mark character. In the example above, the single occurrence of a " sequence breaks the syntax hilighting for the entire rest of the file.

Please adjust the Tcl lexer to reflect this in the syntax hilighting.
fields.summary: Tcl syntax hilighting does not handle \" quotation mark escapes (BB-11763)

fields.description: While typing a long source code comment, I realized that it made another source code comment obsolete and clicked the "Delete" link of that obsolete comment blob. I confirmed that I want to delete, and the obsolete comment was deleted as expected. Unfortunately, the long comment I was working on has also disappeared!
fields.summary: When I delete an inline commit comment, any comment fields that are being edited are cancelled and lost. (BB-11717)

fields.description:
We use pull requests and were really happy with them.

One feature i would like is to have the pull request description in the merge commit message. Its a shame that a good description will get lost in the merge unless you manually copy it there.

Another awesome shortcut button would be to have who reviewed and approved the code on that message to.
fields.summary: Have more information in pull request merge commit message (BB-11707)

fields.description: Add a way to define custom branch types/prefixes in the repo settings, and have them show up under "Branch Type" when creating a new branch.
fields.summary: Custom Branch Types/Prefixes (BB-11708)

fields.description:
I'm looking at the "Branches" page for my repository.

At the top of this page are two buttons: "Active" and "Merged." When I\\
hover over them, I get pop-ups that tell me what they mean and,\\
therefore, suggest why they may be useful.

That's all great – but I _*really*_ want to see _*all*_ my branches. All at\\
once. No exceptions.

Not being able to do this is very frustrating.
fields.summary: On the "Branches" page, I want to be able to see ALL my branches. (BB-11699)

fields.summary: ADG - right-hand items header menu should not have a dropdown arrow (BB-11698)

fields.description:
Our feature branches are most often single-developer work areas, and it would be nice to know who basically "owns" (or at least last touched) each of the open features branches on this page.

Right now, I have to drill into each one to know who's working in them.
fields.summary: Add "Latest Commit Author" to the Branches page (BB-11697)

Getting build failure in Jenkins for Bitbucket. Please help

Started by user anonymous\\
Building in workspace /root/.jenkins/jobs/Test/workspace

bq. git rev-parse --is-inside-work-tree # timeout=10\\
Fetching changes from the remote Git repository\\
git config remote.origin.url https://user:password@bitbucket.org/user/bb_git_maven_jenkins2.git # timeout=10\\
Fetching upstream changes from https://user@bitbucket.org/user/bb_git_maven_jenkins2.git\\

fields.summary: Jenkins Build failure for Bitbucket

fields.description:
The Referer header is optional as per HTTP specification. Bitbucket thus breaks the specification.

This is a major annoyance for me, especially since it's not possible to selectively turn on the Referer header only on specific sites.
fields.summary: Bitbucket relies on the Referer HTTP header (BB-11761)

fields.description:
You recently added pull request tasks (https://blog.bitbucket.org/2014/09/16/introducing-pull-request-tasks/) which is awesome. I'd like to see the same for commits as well. Let me explain.

My team generally uses feature/issue branches and pull requests but for certain projects what team members do is so interconnected (because of the project being in its infancy, with many changes building the foundation) that it's not practical to develop in separate branches (hence it would basically need that everybody frequently merges from everybody else's branches to keep up to date with others' changes). Thus we review single commits and comment on them.

In our workflow once all feedback is covered that was given on a commit (in a later commit), that commit is approved. This works OK but of course has the same issues that are solved with PR tasks. Thus it would be great to also be able to build such a check list for commits as well.
fields.summary: Pull Request Tasks for commits too

fields.description:
Hi,

Am trying to clone the repository but am getting the below error:

remote: Counting objects: 4612, done.\\
remote: Compressing objects: 100% (2914/2914), done.\\
efrror: RPC failed; result=18, HTTP code = 200 28.00 KiB/s\\
fatal: The remote end hung up unexpectedly\\
atal: early EOF\\
fatal: index-pack failed

As suggested have tried :\\
git config --global http.postBuffer 524288000

But, still am facing the same issue.\\
Could anyone please help.

Thanks and Regards,\\
Bhavani
fields.summary: fatal: The remote end hung up unexpectedly

fields.description:
Hi there,\\
when I make "git pull" on my server, I'm getting an "Internal Server Error (500)" after refreshing the page. I'm pulling commit where I changed only 3 PHP files. When I clone repository then it works fine. Files` permissions are good. It started yesterday.
fields.summary: Internal Server Error (500) after git pull

fields.description:
When rendering a diff, Bitbucket shows a few lines of context. It is possible to expand that context by clicking "...". A comment left for one of the "expanded" source code lines becomes invisible when the diff is later loaded by another user (I guess) or reloaded by the commenting user (tested).

The invisible comment is counted and preserved, but one has to expand the context again to actually see it, which makes that comment useless.
fields.summary: Pull request comments on unchanged lines should be expanded in the diff (BB-11695)

fields.description:
I deleted my account for reregister. Now I can't get same username. I want get same username. Can any staff please help me?

Note: On Github I could get same username after I deleted it.
fields.summary: Deleted User Accounts

{code}
#!bash

C:\projects\kirkkara_api>hg push --debug --verbose
pushing to https://edmenendez@bitbucket.org/zumatech/kirkkara_backend
using https://bitbucket.org/zumatech/kirkkara_backend
http auth: user edmenendez, password not set
sending capabilities command
using auth.bb.* for authentication
bitbucket.org certificate successfully verified
using auth.bb.* for authentication
http auth: user edmenendez, password *********
using auth.bb.* for authentication
bitbucket.org certificate successfully verified
query 1; heads
sending batch command
using auth.bb.* for authentication
searching for changes
all remote heads known locally
preparing listkeys for "phases"
sending listkeys command
using auth.bb.* for authentication
checking for updated bookmarks
preparing listkeys for "bookmarks"
sending listkeys command
using auth.bb.* for authentication

{code}

And it simply gets stuck here forever.
fields.summary: Stuck Trying to Push Files

fields.description: https://bitbucket.org/api/2.0/repositories/{owner}/{repo_slug}/pullrequests/{pull_request_id}/comments will give you deleted comments, as well. I think, a client usually won't be interested in deleted comments, hence they should be skipped. If you still want to report them, please include a "deleted" flag with such comments.
fields.summary: API v2: list of pull request comments contains deleted ones which can't be distinguished from active ones (BB-11691)

Hello,

When I am on the commits view of a project, I can not find out which commit is on develop or master branch.\\
I have no detail for each commit.

See the attached screenshot to get what I mean.
fields.summary: Why commits view does not show "master" or "develop" branch detail ?

fields.description:
I'm using sourcetree for my project. Had been making changes and pushing with no issue. Lately I had made a change to a file in my project (changelog). Sourcetree correctly detects the change and I can stage, but when I try to push, it doen't offer me to write a comment and directly tries to do the push. But it fails, telling that all is up-to-date and then returns to main screen showing me the changes on the file.

I've tried to discard the changes and redo them, also doing a repo reset, but whenever I try to push those changes I says it's up to date and does nothing.
fields.summary: Can't push a change to Bitbucket.

But I cannot delete the repo because it is in read-only mode.\\
Can you help me?\\
Thank you!
fields.summary: Cannot delete read-only repository
